page.title: 14COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Radio and television provide news and entertainment in most homes. Girls and boys deliver national daily papers before going to school. Weekly papers based on Marlborough, Swindon and Newbury cover personalities and local news. 60% of homes and 2 callboxes have worldwide dialling telephones. A sub-PO has postal and cash services with 2 mail deliveries each day. Two magazines, supported by local ad- vertisers, are edited in the village. A free bi-monthly covering parish news and views, correspondence and profiles reaches every house and distant parts. A church magazine with a pastoral focus unites both churches and Baydon. Social and public notices use the Parish Notice Board and shops. The newsagent has a window for personal wants and sales as well as a copier. Simple maps and guides are on display
